description: A site where seven olla containing charcoal from burnt brush and the remains of puppies were found left in the marshes. The remains have been interpreted as the results of a ritual, and due to this the Rural Settlement of Roman Britain project loosely catalogued it as a shrine, despite the lack of any structure.
bibliography: Hume, Noel. “Ritual Burials on the Upchurch Marshes.” Archaeologia Cantiana LXX (1956): 160–67.

Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Salt Hill Saltings, Upchurch (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/archives/view/romangl/fullrecord.cfm?id=9128&display=list.
